What is Dhamma?

Dhamma (Pali) or Dharma (Sanskrit) is a key concept with multiple meanings in Indian religions, such as Hinduism, Buddhism, Jainism, and Sikhism. It refers to the cosmic law and order, as well as the duties, rights, laws, conduct, virtues and "right way of living".

It is the eternal and inherent nature of reality, regarded as a cosmic law underlying right behavior and social order.

Buddhism

The path of practice and spiritual development leading to Insight into the true nature of reality.

Hinduism

An Indian religion and dharma, or way of life, widely practiced in the Indian subcontinent and parts of Southeast Asia.

Jainism

A nontheistic religion founded in India in the 6th century BC by the Jina Vardhamana Mahavira.

Sikhism

A monotheistic religion founded in Punjab in the 15th century by Guru Nanak.
